Sentencas: Cathode is a key factor that determines performance of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Properties of composite cathodes composed of Pr3+-deficient perovskite oxide and ionic conductor Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9

Sentencas: Here, new composite materials based on Pr3+-deficient double-layered perovskite oxide Pr(0.95)BaCo(2)O(6-delta )and Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9, marked as P-0.(95) BCO-xSDC (x = 0, 30, 40, 50 wt%) were synthesized.
Titulo: Properties of composite cathodes composed of Pr3+-deficient perovskite oxide and ionic conductor Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9

Sentencas: Thermal expansion coefficient of the composite cathodes decreases with the higher SDC content.
Titulo: Properties of composite cathodes composed of Pr3+-deficient perovskite oxide and ionic conductor Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9

Sentencas: Addition of SDC was found to decrease total electrical conductivities of the cathode but enhance its catalytic activity over oxygen reduction reaction (ORR).
Titulo: Properties of composite cathodes composed of Pr3+-deficient perovskite oxide and ionic conductor Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9

Sentencas: Area specific resistance (ASR) of the cathodes first decreases from x = 0 to x = 40 wt%
Titulo: Properties of composite cathodes composed of Pr3+-deficient perovskite oxide and ionic conductor Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9

Sentencas: and then slightly increase at x = 50 wt%.
Titulo: Properties of composite cathodes composed of Pr3+-deficient perovskite oxide and ionic conductor Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9

Sentencas: Addition of SDC could promote ionic transfer process across the cathode/electrolyte interface, leading to small ASRs at low temperatures for the composite cathodes.
Titulo: Properties of composite cathodes composed of Pr3+-deficient perovskite oxide and ionic conductor Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9

Sentencas: Among the studied samples, the x = 40 wt% cathode exhibited the highest ORR catalytic activity characteristic of the lowest ASR values ranging from 0.005 Omega cm(2) at 750 degrees C to 0.288 Omega cm(2) 500 degrees C with Ea of 1.02eV. An anode supported single cell was fabricated based on the x = 40 wt% cathode, and high peak powder densities, such as 1171 mW cm(-2) at 750 degrees C and 917 mW cm(-2) at 700 degrees C were achieved, further demonstrating its high ORR catalytic activity as a promising cathode material.
Titulo: Properties of composite cathodes composed of Pr3+-deficient perovskite oxide and ionic conductor Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9
